entry.title: Vite report on Fri, 15 Sep 2023 08:03:49
entry.summary:
Tech:
- iPhone 15 Pro deals: The best trade-in values from Verizon, AT&T, and more
- Apple's A17 Pro Within 10% of i9-13900K, 7950X in Single-Core Performance
- The next emoji coming to your phone include head shakes and a phoenix
- Rivian CEO’s plan to make EVs cheaper starts with their computers
- In Photos: Cyclone Rages On Jupiter In Jaw-Dropping New Images From NASA’s Juno
- ‘Saw X’ creates a clever parody of AMC’s Nicole Kidman ad—then deletes it
- Google Settles for $93 Million in California Over Location Privacy Issues
- Tesla's 18-wheeler Semi can travel 500 miles on one charge. Look inside.
- Mysterious flashes of light on Venus aren't what scientists thought, according to a new study. And it could mean safer missions to the planet in the future.
- How bank paper statement fees work, and ways to avoid them
- Bob Iger's grand plan for Disney is moving fast with reported talks to sell ABC
- NASA says UFOs are probably balloons, planes, or solar glints — but not aliens
- MGM Resorts is still suffering from a massive outage after a notorious group of young hackers apparently tricked workers into handing over access to the company's network
- 2 IHG credit cards have welcome bonuses of up to 140,000 points and a $100 statement credit, but the offers are ending soon
- How to watch Thursday Night Football for free: Eagles vs. Vikings live stream
- Here’s a look at the expanded New York City in Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
- Netflix’s live-action One Piece to set sail with even more episodes
- Resident Evil 4 remake is getting its Separate Ways DLC on September 21st
- Ig Nobel Prizes honor zombie spiders, rock-licking scientists, and a clever commode
- Leaked Specs and Images: Surface Laptop Studio 2 and Surface Laptop Go 3 Steal the Spotlight
- Unbundling Teams from Office Has Failed to Allay the EU’s Microsoft Antitrust Concerns – Formal Measures Incoming

Business:
- ‘One of the Most Hated People in the World’: Sam Bankman-Fried’s 250 Pages of Justifications
- Bob Iger's grand plan for Disney is moving fast with reported talks to sell ABC
- Taking A More Strategic Approach To The 80/20 Rule In Software
- ‘One of the Most Hated People in the World’: Sam Bankman-Fried’s 250 Pages of Justifications
- Unbundling Teams from Office Has Failed to Allay the EU’s Microsoft Antitrust Concerns – Formal Measures Incoming

AI:
- Apple's A17 Pro Within 10% of i9-13900K, 7950X in Single-Core Performance
- What tech CEOs Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Brad Smith have to say about AI regulation

Insights:
- The iPhone 15 Pro deals highlight the trade-in values offered by different carriers, providing consumers with options to upgrade their devices.
- Apple's A17 Pro's impressive single-core performance puts it in competition with high-end processors like the i9-13900K and 7950X.
- The addition of new emojis, including head shakes and a phoenix, brings more expressive options to phone users.
- Rivian CEO's strategy to reduce the cost of electric vehicles starts with optimizing their computers.
- NASA's Juno mission captures stunning images of a cyclone on Jupiter, showcasing the beauty of our solar system.
- Google settles a privacy lawsuit in California, emphasizing the importance of protecting location privacy.
- Tesla's 18-wheeler Semi demonstrates the potential of electric vehicles in long-haul transportation.
- New research challenges previous assumptions about mysterious flashes of light on Venus, potentially improving future missions to the planet.
- Understanding bank paper statement fees can help individuals avoid unnecessary charges.
- Reports suggest that Disney is actively pursuing the sale of ABC as part of its larger strategic plan.
- The ongoing debate surrounding UFO sightings continues, with NASA attributing them to earthly phenomena rather than extraterrestrial activity.
- Cybersecurity incidents, such as the MGM Resorts' network breach, highlight the importance of robust security measures.
- Limited-time offers on IHG credit cards provide opportunities for earning points and statement credits.
- Streaming Thursday Night Football for free allows fans to enjoy live sports without additional costs.
- The expansion of New York City in Marvel's Spider-Man 2 offers an exciting virtual experience for gamers.
- Netflix's live-action adaptation of One Piece promises to deliver even more episodes to fans of the popular anime series.
- The release of the Separate Ways DLC for Resident Evil 4 remake adds new content for players to explore.
- The Ig Nobel Prizes recognize unconventional scientific achievements, showcasing the diversity of research.
- Leaked specifications and images of upcoming Microsoft Surface laptops generate excitement among tech enthusiasts.
- The EU's concerns about Microsoft's bundling of Teams with Office products indicate potential antitrust measures.

Overall Insights:
- The tech industry continues to evolve rapidly, with advancements in smartphones, processors, electric vehicles, and space exploration.
- Privacy and security remain significant concerns, as highlighted by Google's settlement and the MGM Resorts' network breach.
- The entertainment industry, represented by Disney's strategic plans and the release of new content, demonstrates its adaptability and growth.
- The intersection of AI and regulation is a topic of interest for tech CEOs, reflecting the need for responsible development and governance.
- The EU's scrutiny of Microsoft's practices underscores the ongoing efforts to ensure fair competition and consumer choice in the software market.
